definitions.definition: Spontaneous emission of ionizing radiation as a consequence of a nuclear reaction , or directly from the breakdown of an unstable nucleus .
The radiation so emitted; including gamma rays , alpha particles , neutrons , electrons , positrons , etc.

main_definition: Spontaneous emission of ionizing radiation as a consequence of a nuclear reaction , or directly from the breakdown of an unstable nucleus .
secondary_definitions: The radiation so emitted; including gamma rays , alpha particles , neutrons , electrons , positrons , etc.
